During Drosophila oogenesis , the posterior determinant , Oskar , is tightly localized at the posterior pole of the oocyte .The exclusive accumulation of Oskar at this site is ensured by localization - dependent translation of oskar mRNA : translation of oskar mRNA is repressed during transport and activated upon localization at the posterior cortex .
